UPDATED 27 Sept and added stars. I feel I owe Tuya an apology, since recently IFTTT's true strategy has become apparent - CORPORATE GREED. First they try to milk companies such as Tuya, already committed to their platform, now they are trying to 'charge at both ends' via a 'subscription model' to milk the consumer as well. I can now imagine why Tuya felt the need to made a stand. Perhaps all their connected companies should? Personally, I'm having none of it - I've pulled all of my IFTTT bespoke widgets and will find an alternative solution, or just live with it. IFTTT has some value but it is far from indispensable, or perfect. Meanwhile, sorry Tuya for writing the below review originally! This app and your Smart Life apps are good and have built in features which I may need to rely on, now I've shut down my IFTTT widgets. ORIGINAL REVIEW WAS: It has become useless to me now that Tuya have abandoned IFTTT. My smart devices were ALL sold to me as supporting IFTTT. And they did. But now they don't. Like many other people, I don't necessarily want to automate everything using voice but rather to implement controls using intelligent macros from any IT platform, especially Windows - which Tuya apps don't support. Smart life gadgets claiming to support IFTTT are now misdescribed! Certainly, while this situation persists, I won't be purchasing or recommending any further smart gadgets that require either the Tuya or the Smart Life apps. *** and it used to be so good *** TUYA - ADDRESS THIS PROBLEM VERY SOON OR EXPECT MORE PEOPLE TO VOTE WITH THEIR FEET!!
